moves.2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Bb4: Winawer.  Just starting to learn this.
moves.4. e5 Ne7: GM Simon Williams recommends this move in his videos, "Killer French". It's less popular than c5, though. Looking through the game now, though, that I never even moved my c-pawn; hardly a normal French.
moves.5. a3 Bxc3+ 6. bxc3 O-O: Castling is generally good, but I don't think I was ready for it. I needed to develop more pieces first, as well as play get the C pawn out.
moves.7. Bd3 f5: Serious blunder, blithely carrying out my plans without watching what my opponent is doing. Ng6 would have been better defensively.
moves.8. exf6 e.p. Rxf6 9. Qh5 g6: Ng6 might have been better, but it allowed Bg5! pinning the R to the Q. Looks to me like it's already over. I don't have a good defense. My entire queen side hasn't budged except the d pawn.
moves.10. Qg5 Qf8: The only move, but my Q is seriously overworked, protecting the N, R, and h6. All momentum is with my opponent.
moves.11. h4 Nbc6: Desperately trying to bring in some help. Nd7 leaves the N no where to go.
moves.12. h5 Nd8 13. hxg6 Nxg6 14. Qh5 Qg7: Very bad. Qf7 was better. Ended up there anyway, but gave the opponent an extra tempo this way.
